item.title: [317]how do i make my client login to only my server?
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Go into the Client’s file “gui.java” and search for
"public void initUI()
{
try
{
setServer(“YourServerIp”); "
If your Client doesn’t have a gui.java and has the egui.java it is different.
Open up “egui.java” and search for

“public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
//”", “YourServerIp”, “YourServerIp”, “YourServerIp”
“LocalHostIp”, “LocalHostIp”, “LocalHostIp” "

Save and Compile. When You log in, it will be your server only.

Your Welcome, GrimReapersScythe.

Read full topic

item.title: [317]how do i make my client login to only my server?
item.dc:creator: @joewizard100 joewizard100
item.description:
@joewizard100 wrote:

i have done this recently. so you are in luck. go into your client folder and open up client.java, search for this…

"Username:

you should see a line of code like this…

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xffffFF, "Username: " + aString1173 + ((anInt1216 == 0) & (anInt1161 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j); j += 15; aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xffffff, "Password: " + Class50.method588(aString1174, 0) + ((anInt1216 == 1) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "|" : ""), j); j += 15; aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Server IP: " + server + ((anInt1216 == 0) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j); j += 15; aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Port: " + port + ((anInt1216 == 3) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j); j += 15;

now just delete the bit where it says Server ip and port like bassically just delete all of this line…

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Server IP: " + server + ((anInt1216 == 0) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j); j += 15;

after that save it . now scroll to the top again and search for this…

setserver(

next to it in the quotes should be the ip you set it too… just change it to the ip you want so mine is like this…

setserver("thejoeyscape.no-ip.org", "43594");

Save it, close it. then COMPILE!!!

all done. deleting that part i told you simply removes the bit which says Server IP under password for people to type in the ip.

Read full topic
